level.heading: Jurisdiction.
level.text: A petitioner may file a petition for protection under this subchapter if:
The petitioner resides, lives, works, or attends school in the District of Columbia:
The petitioner is under the legal custody of a District government agency; or
The underlying offense occurred in the District of Columbia.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 17-368 rewrote the section, which had read as follows: "The Family Division may dismiss a petition if the matter is not appropriate for disposition in the Family Division."

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 4-144
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 4-144, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 16-1001.
